DataElement.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance Product Material Action Mode Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded value specifying the mode of action through which this substance produces a pharmacological effect. EXAMPLE(S): stimulating action, depressing action, blocking/antagonizing action, stabilizing action, exchanging/replacing substances, direct beneficial chemical reaction, direct harmful chemical reaction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance Product Material Action Mode Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._A thing done.:A particular functioning condition or arrangement.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Concepts.definition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Property.preferredDefinition: A thing done.:A particular functioning condition or arrangement.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A particular functioning condition or arrangement.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
